org.onyxplatform.api.java.utils

Class AsyncLifecycles

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.onyxplatform.api.java.utils.AsyncLifecycles
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OnyxNames

    public class AsyncLifecycles
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnyxNames
    AsyncLifecycles is a static utility class designed to allow easy binding of user inputs (vector input segments) to input tasks in asynchronous channels using the Onyx Lifecycle concept and the core-async plugin. AsyncLifecycles should be used by Tasks set up using the AsyncCatalog utility so that Onyx knows what tasks need to take care of what inputs. With an existing Job Lifecycles object lc, and an async task "in", this utility would be used as AsyncLifecycles.addInput(lc, "in"); this then lets Onyx know that the "in" task should happen upon job setup.

      • addInput

        public static Lifecycles addInput(Lifecycles lifecycles,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Adds a new lifecycle object with the given name to the specified lifecycles object. Returns the updated Lifecycles object.
        Parameters:
        lifecycles - Lifecycles object to be updated with new Lifecycle
        name - Name of new AsyncLifecycle to create and add
        Returns:
        Returns the updated Lifecycles object

      • bindInputs

        public static void bindInputs(Lifecycles l,
                              clojure.lang.PersistentVector inputs)
        Binds input segments (a PersistentVector of inputs, can be filename strings, etc.) to the lifecycles. This ensures the async channels are loaded with the inputs.
        Parameters:
        l - The lifecycles object which the inputs should be bound to
        inputs - a PersistentVector of input segments to be bound

      • addOutput

        public static Lifecycles addOutput(Lifecycles lifecycles,
                                   java.lang.String name)
        Adds an async output lifecycle with the specified name to the specified Lifecycles object. The lifecycle name should be the name of an existing asynchronous task.
        Parameters:
        lifecycles - The lifecycles object to which the output lifecycle should be added
        name - name of the output lifecycle object
        Returns:
        Returns the updated Lifecycles object

      • collectOutputs

        public static clojure.lang.IPersistentMap collectOutputs(Lifecycles l,
                                                         java.lang.String outputName)
        This binds the output specified in the Lifecycle to a core.async reader plugin and collects outputs. NOTE: this and the other collectOutputs static function are broken into 2 pieces because Clojure doesn't handle variable arity functions across the langauge boundary.
        Parameters:
        l - the lifecycles object the outputs should be bound to
        outputName - the name of the output lifecycle to collect outputs from
        Returns:
        an IPersistentMap of the collected outputs

      • collectOutputs

        public static clojure.lang.IPersistentMap collectOutputs(Lifecycles l,
                                                         java.lang.String outputName1,
                                                         java.lang.String... restOfTheNames)
        This binds the output specified in the Lifecycle to a core.async reader plugin and collects outputs. NOTE: this and the other collectOutputs static function are broken into 2 pieces because Clojure doesn't handle variable arity functions across the langauge boundary.
        Parameters:
        l - the lifecycles object the outputs should be bound to
        outputName1 - the name of the first output lifecycle to collect outputs from
        restOfTheNames - the name(s) of the rest of the output lifecycles to collect outputs from
        Returns:
        an IPersistentMap of the collected outputs

      • collectOutputs

        public static clojure.lang.IPersistentMap collectOutputs(Job j,
                                                         java.lang.String... names)
        Convenience function which mirrors the behavior of the other collectOutputs methods, except this version can be called directly on a Job. For the specified job, collects the outputs from the specified output lifecycle names. Returns an IPersistentMap of the outputs.
        Parameters:
        j - the job object for which to collect outputs
        names - the name(s) of the lifecycles for which outputs are expected
        Returns:
        an IPersistentMap of the collected outputs
